briefdescription.para: Classify a circle according to sphere, as defined in Section Spherical Kernel Objects.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CGAL::Circular_arc_point_3< SphericalKernel > &p, const CGAL::Circular_arc_point_3< SphericalKernel > &q, const CGAL::Sphere_3< SphericalKernel > &sphere)
memberdef.name: compare_theta

briefdescription.para: Compares the $ \theta$-coordinates of p and q relatively to sphere.

simplesect.para: p and q lie on sphere, but do not coincide with the poles of sphere.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CGAL::Circular_arc_point_3< SphericalKernel > &p, const CGAL::Vector_3< SphericalKernel > &m, const CGAL::Sphere_3< SphericalKernel > &sphere)
memberdef.name: compare_theta

briefdescription.para: Compares the $ \theta$-coordinates of p and of the meridian defined by m (see Section Spherical Kernel Objects) in the cylindrical coordinate system relative to sphere.

simplesect.para: p lies on sphere, but does not coincide with its poles. m $ \neq(0,0,0)$ and the $ z$-coordinate of m is $ 0$.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CGAL::Vector_3< SphericalKernel > &m, const CGAL::Circular_arc_point_3< SphericalKernel > &p, const CGAL::Sphere_3< SphericalKernel > &sphere)
memberdef.name: compare_theta

briefdescription.para: Compares the $ \theta$-coordinates of the meridian defined by m and of p (see Section Spherical Kernel Objects) in the cylindrical coordinate system relative to sphere.

simplesect.para: p lies on sphere, but does not coincide with its poles. m $ \neq(0,0,0)$ and the $ z$-coordinate of m is $ 0$.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CGAL::Circular_arc_point_3< SphericalKernel > &p, const CGAL::Circular_arc_point_3< SphericalKernel > &q, const CGAL::Sphere_3< SphericalKernel > &sphere)
memberdef.name: compare_theta_z

briefdescription.para: Compares p and q according to the lexicographic ordering on $ \theta$ and $ z$-coordinates in the cylindrical coordinate system relative to sphere.

simplesect.para: p and q lie on sphere, but do not coincide with the poles of sphere.

briefdescription.para: Tests whether the arc a is $ \theta$-monotone, i.e. the intersection of any meridian anchored at the poles sphere and the arc a is reduced to at most one point in general, and two points if a pole of sphere is an endpoint of the arc.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that a bipolar circle has no such arcs.
a lies on sphere, and the supporting circle of a is not bipolar.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CGAL::Circle_3< SphericalKernel > &c, const CGAL::Sphere_3< SphericalKernel > sphere, bool b)
memberdef.name: theta_extremal_point

briefdescription.para: Returns the point on the circle that is extremal in $ \theta$ using the cylindrical coordinate system relative to sphere, and that has the smallest (resp. largest) $ \theta$-coordinate of the two points if b is true (resp. false).

detaileddescription.para:
See Section Spherical Kernel Objects for definitions.
c lies on sphere and is a normal circle.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CGAL::Circle_3< SphericalKernel > &c, const CGAL::Sphere_3< SphericalKernel > &sphere, OutputIterator res)
memberdef.name: theta_extremal_points

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ \theta$-extremal points of the circle relatively to sphere.

detaileddescription.para:
res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted in the cylindrical coordinate system relative to sphere. See Section Spherical Kernel Objects for definitions.
c lies on sphere and is a normal circle.

briefdescription.para: Returns the point on the sphere that is extremal in the $ x$-direction, and that is the smallest (resp. largest) of the two $ x$-extremal points for the lexicographic order if b is true (resp. false).
Same for a circle.

simplesect.para: The circle is not contained in a plane orthogonal to the $ x$-axis.

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ x$-extremal points of the sphere.

detaileddescription.para: res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted.

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ x$-extremal points of the circle.

detaileddescription.para:
res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted.
The circle is not contained in a plane orthogonal to the $ x$-axis.

briefdescription.para: Returns the point on the sphere that is extremal in the $ y$-direction, and that is the smallest (resp. largest) of the two $ y$-extremal points for the lexicographic order if b is true (resp. false).
Same for a circle.

simplesect.para: The circle is not contained in a plane orthogonal to the $ y$-axis.

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ y$-extremal points of the sphere.

detaileddescription.para: res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted.

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ y$-extremal points of the circle.

detaileddescription.para:
res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted.
The circle is not contained in a plane orthogonal to the $ y$-axis.

briefdescription.para: Returns the point on the sphere that is extremal in the $ z$-direction, and that is the smallest (resp. largest) of the two $ z$-extremal points for the lexicographic order if b is true (resp. false).
Same for a circle.

simplesect.para: The circle is not contained in a plane orthogonal to the $ z$-axis.

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ z$-extremal points of the sphere.

detaileddescription.para: res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted.

briefdescription.para: Copies in the output iterator the $ z$-extremal points of the circle.

detaileddescription.para:
res iterates on elements of type Circular_arc_point_3<SphericalKernel>, lexicographically sorted.
The circle is not contained in a plane orthogonal to the $ z$-axis.
